intro: Oreocarya affinis, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its growth habit is usually low and mat-forming, with stems that are often prostrate or ascending. Oreocarya affinis is part of the Primulaceae family and is adapted to cold, dry climates with short growing seasons.
